instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B backlight theatre lights
threads.message:
Water damaged board a tiny bit in the lvds area, replaced everything i saw that looked damaged. Now I get a picture and backlight. But the backlight is like theatre lights. It looks like they aren't all coming on only every other lights is, if that makes any sense.

I remember louis saying something about this in a video just can't remember what it was. LVDS connector already replaced.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B backlight theatre lights
threads.message: Check all return led resistors from <RESISTOR>R9717</RESISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R9722</RESISTOR> and traces, also check your soldering job on the connector....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B backlight theatre lights
threads.message: everything measured fine. replaced <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> again and its now working fine
